These plants are native to the Andes Mountains in South America, where they thrive in cool, humid environments. Stapfia species are characterized by their striking, often colorful bracts that resemble petals, though they are actually modified leaves. Due to their unique appearance and limited distribution, Stapfia plants are often cultivated as ornamental specimens in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
